spanishExample: ¿Cuál es el problema?
englishTranslation: What is the problem?

spanishExample: ¿Hay una buena razón por la que no podrían estar aquí?
englishTranslation: Is there a good reason for which they wouldn’t be able to be here?
vocabIncluded: "la que" to mean "which" after a preposition
hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
podrían: "would be able", "they would be able" (Poder, conditional, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: ¿Podrías estar aquí esa noche?
englishTranslation: Would you be able to be here that evening?
vocabIncluded: podrías: "would be able", "you would be able" (Poder, conditional, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Él puede ir.
englishTranslation: He can go.

spanishExample: Ella te podría *give* el que tiene.
englishTranslation: She would be able to give you the one that (m) she has.
vocabIncluded: podría: "would be able", "he/she/it would be able" (Poder, conditional, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: *I hope* que puedan *arrive* a tiempo, porque yo no podré.
englishTranslation: I hope they can arrive on time, because I won’t be able to.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
podré: "will be able", "I will be able" (Poder, future, 1st person)
puedan: "be able", "they be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Estamos de acuerdo - no podíamos hacerlo.
englishTranslation: We are in agreement: we weren’t able to do it.
vocabIncluded: podíamos: "were able", "we were able" (Poder, imperfect, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: *I hope* que puedas ir para que yo pueda ir contigo.
englishTranslation: I hope you can go so that I can go with you.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
pueda: "be able", "I be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 1st person)
puedas: "be able", "you be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: La señora se la podrá *give* a mi amiga.
englishTranslation: The lady will be able to give it(f) to my friend(f).
vocabIncluded: "se" to mean "le" or "les", as in "se lo" or "se la"
a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
podrá: "will be able", "he/she/it will be able" (Poder, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Le *I told* a mi amiga que ella era la que podía hacerlo.
englishTranslation: I told my friend that she was the one that was able to do it.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
le: "her/him" as an indirect object ("to her/him", "for her/him")
podía: "was able", "he/she/it was able" (Poder, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No podría ir contigo.
englishTranslation: I wouldn’t be able to go with you.
vocabIncluded: podría: "would be able", "I would be able" (Poder, conditional, 1st person)

spanishExample: No pudo ir ese día.
englishTranslation: He didn’t manage to go that day.
vocabIncluded: pudo: "was able / managed", "he/she/it was able / managed" (Poder, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No vamos a poder hacer lo que ellos pueden hacer.
englishTranslation: We aren’t going to be able to do what they can do.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Podemos hacer el trabajo con cuidado.
englishTranslation: We can do the job carefully.

spanishExample: Podían hacer el trabajo.
englishTranslation: They were able to do the work.
vocabIncluded: podían: "were able", "they were able" (Poder, imperfect, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Podías hacerlo cuando eras *a child,* pero ahora no puedes.
englishTranslation: You were able to do it when you were a child, but now you can’t.
vocabIncluded: podías: "were able", "you were able" (Poder, imperfect, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Puede que ella no pueda ir.
englishTranslation: It might be that she can’t go.
vocabIncluded: pueda: "be able", "he/she/it be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Puedo tener cuidado.
englishTranslation: I can be careful.
vocabIncluded: tener cuidado: "to be careful" (idiom, lit. "to have carefulness")

spanishExample: Se lo ha podido hacer.
englishTranslation: She has been able to make it for him.
vocabIncluded: "se" to mean "le" or "les", as in "se lo" or "se la"
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si yo pudiera *to cook,* nosotros podríamos *to eat.*
englishTranslation: If I were able to cook, we would be able to eat.
vocabIncluded: podríamos: "would be able", "we would be able" (Poder, conditional, 1st person plural)
pudiera: "were able", "I were able" (Poder, subjunctive past, 1st person)

spanishExample: *They wanted* que él pudiera ir, porque yo no podía.
englishTranslation: They wanted him to be able to go, because I wasn’t able.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
podía: "was able", "I was able" (Poder, imperfect, 1st person)
pudiera: "were able", "he/she/it were able" (Poder, subjunctive past, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tuve una idea, pero no pude hacerla.
englishTranslation: I had an idea, but I wasn’t able to do it.
vocabIncluded: pude: "was able / managed", "I was able / managed" (Poder, preterite, 1st person)
